meanings.definition: A hole dug in the ground to hold a post.
meanings.sent1: The farmer dug postholes to set up a fence around his field.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers marked the locations for the postholes before starting the project.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous dog kept jumping in and out of the postholes, thinking they were tunnels.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a map with postholes of memories waiting to be filled with new experiences.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist carefully examined the postholes to uncover clues about the ancient civilization.

meanings.definition: The act of digging holes in the ground to hold posts.
meanings.sent1: After hours of postholes, the team finally finished preparing the area for the new structure.
meanings.sent2: The postholes were dug with precision to ensure the stability of the structure.
meanings.sent3: The children turned the postholes into a game of who could dig the deepest without getting tired.
meanings.sent4: The community came together, each person contributing to the postholes that would support the new community center.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of shovels hitting the ground filled the air as the postholes multiplied across the field.
